title: Electric flux - charged sphere at corner of a cube

content.question: A small, charged conducting sphere is located with its center at the corner of a large cube, as shown in the figure. Rank the magnitude <math alttext="phi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi></math> of the electric flux through the cube faces labeled <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>, and <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>.

choices.label: <math alttext="phi sub P equals phi sub Q, which equals phi sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub P is greater than phi sub Q, which equals phi sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub Q equals, phi sub R, which is greater than phi sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub Q is greater than phi sub R, which is greater than phi sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="phi sub Q equals, phi sub R, which is greater than phi sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
